required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Controlled Phase IV Study to Compare Bioseal Versus Manual Compression as an Adjunct to Hemostasis in the Patients Undergoing Elective Vascular Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the clinical utility of Bioseal as an adjunct to control bleeding during elective vascular surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) at 10 Minutes Following the Completion of Treatment Application.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with Hemostasis at the TBS at 10 minutes following the completion of treatment application. Hempstasis is defined as absence of bleeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) at 3 and 6 Minutes Following the Completion of Treatment Application
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with Hemostasis at the TBS at 3 and 6 minutes following the completion of treatment application. Hempstasis is defined as absence of bleeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Requiring Alternative Treatment Due to Treatment Failure*
secondary_outcome.description: Alternative treatments include the use of additional hemostatic methods, including collagen, manual compression, oxidized regenerated cellulose and suture. Manual compression (MC) may be applied after the initial 10 minute observation period as an alternative treatment due to treatment failure in either group. For participants with a treatment failure in MC group, the addition treatment of MC is applied after the initial 10 minute observation period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Potential Bleeding-related Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with potential bleeding-related adverse events by study group

arm_group.description: A porcine-derived fibrin sealant consisting of thrombin and fibrinogen
Manual compresssion (MC) include any active or inactive adjunctive treatment to hemostasis methods currently used based on each surgeons surgical practice except for the use of other fibrin sealants.

group.title: Bioseal Fibrin Sealant
group.description: A porcine-derived fibrin sealant consisting of thrombin and fibrinogen.

group.title: Manual Compression
group.description: Manual compression (MC) include any active or inactive adjunctive treatment to hemostasis methods currently used based on each surgeons surgical practice except for the use of other fibrin sealants.

measure.title: BMI Group
measure.description: BMI Categories: Underweight: <18.5 lb/inch^2; Normal: 18.5<=BMI<25; Overweight: 25<=BMI<30 Obese: 30<=BMI<40 Morbidly obese: BMI>=40

reported_events.time_frame: AEs were collected from the start of randomization during the procedure until completion of the 30 day follow-up visit.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
